item.title: Wipro Technologies
item.description: Joined Wipro Technologies in October 2021 as a Cloud & DevOps Engineer in the Hybrid Platform Team. This team is responsible for managing infrastructure in both on-premise and cloud. Some responsiblities as part of this roles are: Managing over 120+ subscriptions in Azure using Terraform (Open Source) and Azure Repos as central repository for management Build and Support Infrastructure services like Virtual Machines, Storage, Virtual Network, Log Analytics, Automation Account, Kubernetes Cluster, Container Registry Create and manage DevOps pipelines for continuous management of infra services using Infrastructure as Code.

item.title: Tata Consultancy Services
item.description: Joined Tata Consultancy Services as a fresher in March 2015. Started as a Windows Server Administrator and gradually worked towards Cloud Infrastructure. Worked across various teams and technologies. Few roles and responisbilities during my journey in TCS Cloud & DevOps Engineer Setup RBAC roles for multiple scopes in Azure (subscription/resource group/resources) using groups. Create PowerShell scripts to build multiple VMs in Azure. Create ARM Templates to standardize builds in Azure.

item.title: Microservices | AKS | Terraform | Azure DevOps
item.description: Working on a project where multiple applications are getting deployed as containers. AKS is used as the container orchestration platform, Azure Container Registry (ACR) is used to store the container images. Container images are built using Docker. Build pipeline is created in Azure DevOps and jobs are run using Self-Hosted Linux Agent server. Below Infrastructure components were created using Terraform Azure Linux VM (RHEL) Azure Data Factory Azure Windows VM(Self Hosted Integration Runtime for ADF) Azure Cosmos DB (PGSQL) Azure Storage Account Azure Container Registry Private Endpoints for ACR,Storage Account, PGSQL, ADF Azure Key Vault Private Azure Kubernetes Cluster with Application Gateway Ingress Controller and Key Vault Integration Linux VM was configured as Self-Hosted Agent server to run Azure DevOps pipeline for building Docker images.

item.title: Azure Monitoring | Log Analytics
item.description: In a hub-spoke model, different application workloads were deployed to spoke subscriptions. All the VMs in spoke subscriptions has to be connected to central Log Analytics Workspace in the hub subscription. To achieve this, the first requirement was to collect information about the log analytics workspace the VMs are currently connected to. Azure Resource Graph Query was used to fetch the extextension details of VMs and in turn collecting the details of Log Analytics Workspace these VMs are connected to.
